Reviews.Title: “Cosy, well priced stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Claire T
Reviews.Content: Lovely little hotel, well priced and conveniently located close to the metro station. The room we had was spotless and cosy. Some people might find the rooms small here, but the size is pretty standard for Europe I think, and great for a couple. My boyfriend and I loved the area too - with a fantastic bakery and various food shops along the street. The area feels very local, even thought it's only about a 12 minute train to the city centre. Service was friendly. I will stay here again when I next return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Cosy & Pretty Hotel”
Reviews.Author: amitshahcorp
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to stay at this hotel for a total of 4 nights during our trip to Paris in September last year.his is a nice family run hotel in a light traffic area of Paris and well within the boundaries of the major sights. We enjoyed staying here because of its warm service, lush morning breakfast and homely atmosphere. The hotel is very conveniently located - about 16 minutes by train to the heart of the city. From Pernety station, it is a comfortable 3 minute walk to the hotel. The streets are lively during the day and moderately well-lit during the night. Infact, on one our late night Paris escapades, we arrived as late as 12 am and there was no issue whatsoever walking through to the hotel. The room was clean, seemed well maintained and slightly cosy in my opinion - however, this is true of a vast majority of hotels in the Paris metropolitan area. The room had a street view and a nice cosy balcony.The bath and shower were modern and efficient though we felt that the bathroom size itself could have been bigger. The walls were a little hollow but that did not bother us much. Also note that there are about 4-5 rooms per floor which is pretty decent for a hotel of this size. The staff is friendly and accommodating. They also helped us with our itinerary plans on a couple of occasions and offered us coffee and take our bags upstairs during our stay. We did not use Room service other than the odd call for a couple of towels and napkins. I must say though that the morning breakfast was delicious and adequate. Please note though that the breakfast is not usually included in the room rate and costs a marginal fee (9 Euros) - well worth the price in our opinion. The breakfast includes delicious homemade jams, croissants, a variety of breads and fruits, cereals and other cold meats. Note that breakfast is served inside the hotel lobby and in the courtyard area. The only one thing that I think there is an opportunity for is that the hotel features a rather tiny elevator and steep stairs since this is a rather narrow building. This may be an issue if you are a disabled traveler. In fact the elevator is small that it was a little difficult to accommodate the 2 of us. Overall, we were happy with our stay and will stay again when we return to our favorite city.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and friendly”
Reviews.Author: RLPC
Reviews.Content: No frills, convenient, clean and friendly hotel. Good for business travellers or for those looking for a base from which to sight-see. Metro is very close and there are lots of nice local shops and cafes nearby. Staff were charming and very helpful. Rooms are tiny though so not a good option if you are planning to spend time at the hotel or looking for a relaxing break. Don't recommend it for couples as rooms and bed were very small.

Reviews.Title: “A year at a Paris hotel”
Reviews.Author: rc00001
Reviews.Content: Over the past year, I have been at the MaisonMontparnasse probably 7 times. It's always fine. After the first time, I ask for a specific room, and they always have it for me! Breakfasts are fine, but like everything else in the hotel, it borders on the cramped. I dislike very much having to share a table at breakfast, and luckily haven't had to do it too often. The bathrooms are tiny, but this is Paris. I can't remember ever having a decent sized bathroom here. The best part (besides the price) is that they always try to accommodate - if I buy a bottle of wine at a store, they open it for me and give me a wine glass! If I spill the wine on my bed (!), they miraculously clean it up. It's a little too Ikea-charming, but it's probably the best mid-priced hotels in Paris. Nice, not overly-friendly staff!

Reviews.Title: “friendly and cosy hotel”
Reviews.Author: indipendente
Reviews.Content: Everything was fine. Good (cold) breakfast at reasonable 9 euros. Nice and clean room, free wifi. Friendly staff, I got back on a Sunday afternoon from touring the city to pick up my bags and they offered coffee. Nice touch. Metro is just around the corner, convenient to get anywhere in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Bohemian flair”
Reviews.Author: Family-C-L
Reviews.Content: Close to the Pernety and the Plaisance metro stations, this small hotel was a perfect choice during a visit with a friend who lived on the same street in the 14th arrondisement. The room was small but nicely decorated and very clean. The bathroom was equally small but has everything you might need, including a wall dryer. The hotel uses 3 main colors of fuchsia, purple and orange, which appear in the curtains, cushions, floors, down to the umbrellas that the friendly hostess offered during a rainy day. The hotel is located off a very busy street that is filled with bakeries, restaurants and shops. There is also a Monoprix down the road. You can easily find places to have some coffee or snacks. The hotel offers good value at a very reasonable price, and with that extra little artistic flair. I didn't have time for breakfast and the hostess kindly offered some tea or coffee, which was very kind. I noticed several other hotels nearby but this property definitely stood out from the rest.

Reviews.Title: “Traffic problems if driving”
Reviews.Author: Worldtraveller744
Reviews.Content: Agree with the other reviews, small rooms, but impeccably clean and nice helpful/friendly staff. If you're driving there, then be aware that there are one way traffic restrictions on Rue d'Alesia. The best way to get to the hotel is to come off the Perepherique at the Porte de Vanves and take the Rue Raymond Losserand north until you come to Rue d'Alesia, turn right and then after about 300 m Rue de Gergovie is a sharp left turn back. Parking is very limited on Saturday and Sunday, but spaces available on street during the week, for a maximum of 2 hours, but the hotel will go and renew your ticket ! They will be getting their own parking soon apparently.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a handy location”
Reviews.Author: Becsey
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights at the start of oct and were surprised by how great it was. The location was fantastic, just a short walk from the train line and an abundance of patisserie and other specialty shops as well as restaurants and cafes. The rooms are small but functional and very clean and the staff were friendly and helpful. Breakfast was awesome, there’s nothing like fresh warm croissant to start the day. I would highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent alternative to small B&B”
Reviews.Author: Brees
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a small b&b with lots direct contact. But since the promising locations were already fully booked, we decided for this hotel. And were quite happy with the choice. Though it is a hotel really, you do get a personal approach and an environment which doesn't feel like "standard hotel stuff". Do try to get a room on the garden side however. The street noise does continue most of the night.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, convenient to train, lovely breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Cheryl C
Reviews.Content: Our hotel stay of 3 nights was perfect. The breakfast was satisfying, with delicious coffee, teas, and breads with pastries. The hotel has modern bathroom finishes and stylish decor, but smallish, especially the elevator. We appreciated Sophie's advice for shoe shopping, as well as her husband's assist with our luggage upon transfer. Although the metro was close, we walked to Notre Dame Cathedral and local restaurants. Definitely, we would recommend La Maison, and hope to return one day.

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel but stuffy”
Reviews.Author: Germite
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights. The hotel is very near the train station (about 3 mins walk), Pernety, so it was great especially that we need to pull out luggages along. When we arrived, we were given a pleasant surprise that they upgraded our room because our original room was too small for our 2 luggages. So thumbs up for that!! In general, the staff was friendly and approachable. We liked the decoration as it was bright and colourful, giving one the feeling on having a holiday. Unfortunately, the bright colour also represented the weather, which was hot! There was a heatwave when we went and because the room has no air condition, it was stuffy. It kinda dampen the mood a little.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE”
Reviews.Author: Delibaba
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights and enjoyed it. The staff were very friendly and spoke good English. The breakfasts were great. The hotel is within walking distance of all the sights of Paris without having to resort to the metro. And finally what a superb colour scheme within it!

Reviews.Title: “Colorful and cheerful”
Reviews.Author: Sharon K
Reviews.Content: Love the bright, coordinated color scheme. The rooms are clean and cheerful, although a little small. My family enjoyed having breakfast at the pretty, sunny patio. The staff are very helpful and friendly. The location is great for exploring the St Germain area. Transport is easy to other places of interest.

Reviews.Title: “Small, Tidy Room”
Reviews.Author: Bob B
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights, Fri-Sun, in September 2011. Price point was high - $170/nt, wouldn't recommend the hotel at this level. Around $100 is more appropriate. We went on to visit 4 cities in Spain. All the hotels there were much larger than this hotel. The bathroom is the smallest one can theoretically be containing a toilet, sink, and shower. At 6'0 I could barely use. Saving grace, beds are high quality. Rooms are kept very clean. No safe or fridge. The neighborhood - less touristy, more locals, is nice. Very safe. About 3 blocks walk to the Metro, which will get you anywhere you need to go.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Caddog
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel situated within easy distance of all the main Paris attractions. The metro station Pernty, on line 13, is a few hundred yards away from the hotel. From this station you can reach the Eiffel Tower, Musee d'Orsay, Lourve and Champs Elysee, to name a few attractions in minutes. The hotel it's self is small with a tiny lift (mind the step when you get out of it), however it, is spotlessly clean and quiet. The English speaking staff are very helpfull. I would definately return however I would book directly with the hotel rather than through Thomas Cook.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Flossie39
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 2 nights and we couldn't have been happier. The decor and furnishings were tasteful, comfortable and spotless, the staff couldn't have been friendlier, there is a lovely, quiet seating area and this helped make our time at the hotel a haven of relaxation in a busy sightseeing trip. I have to single out the bed and bedding for special praise, I have stayed in many hotels over the years of different standards, for business and pleasure and the bed at this hotel was the most comfortable I ever slept in. The area around the hotel is lovely, lots of small streets with loads of small bars, cafes and local shops and strolling around the local area is very pleasant. It's also close to several metro stations so it's easy to get to other areas of the city quickly. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a cosy base to explore Paris and I doubt it could be beaten at the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: JimInMinneapolis
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, clean, comfortable room, bathroom was great. Perfect location only a couple blocks from the metro. Breakfast was good and have only nice things to say about the staff. I will stay there again but definitely will ask for a room off the street; very noisy streetside.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: AlejandroJ80
Reviews.Content: grat value for money, 3 blocks from the metro, great surroundings, they charge for the breakfast but it is very good, the hotel is very quiet which is good, and the staff is very helpfull,I absolutly would choos it again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely horrible”
Reviews.Author: JezJez
Reviews.Content: It's too bad this place is actually quite cute, because the owner was an absolute nightmare. a perfect incarnation of the Parisian attitude not only is hospitality unnecessary, but that rudeness is ok. Upon arrival at the hotel my parents were horrified of how rude he was, and then they were just a little put off by how tiny the rooms were. In the end the rest of the staff was nice. But we just hoped the owner wasn't around when we had to pass through the lobby. Also, my friend was leaving one morning and he chased her down the street like a maniac thinking she was jumping the bill or something....I don't know what. But just do yourself a favor and don't stay here, unless it changes ownership maybe.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome value and location...super friendly and clean”
Reviews.Author: BurdieGirl
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights here and found it to be ideal for our purposes as we wandered about Paris. The location is close to the underground and within walking distance of many sites if your up for a walk. The owners were super helpful and friendly (they speak English) and someone was there 24 hours a day. This is a great value...breakfast was complete and fresh and the rooms, while small were well appointed and the beds comfortable. The style and modern flair fit nicely with Paris. This is an excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value”
Reviews.Author: Anonymous_cyclist
Reviews.Content: Lovely, comfortable hotel. Very helpful staff. Great breakfast. Excellent value for money. Nice area, convenient to metro station. Colourful and quirky!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Londonjacq
Reviews.Content: Perfect hotel for a visit to Paris, easy links into the main areas of the city or alternatively it's easy to walk as well. The rooms are small but very clean and modern, the staff helpful, great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little boutique hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mudsta84
Reviews.Content: Very impressed with La Maison Montparnasse. The room was spacious and loved the en-suite bathroom. The staff were friendly and helpful. The decor was bright and made the hotel feel warm and welcoming. The location of the hotel is in betwseen 2 metro stations and there are plenty of bars/restaurants, patessaries, supermarkets...etc. The only things I didn't like were the lack of electrical sockets (I only had one in my room and that was near the window and nowhere near the bed or desk and there wasn't a mirror in the room, the mirror was in the bathroom. All in all a great hotel and would recommend to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Roally nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: muzzascot
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in August. It was very warm weather, one night not going below 25 degrees (a record for Paris) so it's not a suprise the rooms were hot as there's no aircon, but we knew that when we booked. The big boost was that we had a room to the rear of the building which meant our windows opened out overloking a small courtyard and could be left open all night without noise problems. We didn't get a single bite or notice any insects apart from the odd moth. The rooms were small but very nicely furnished and the bed comfortable. The shower head was a little low for my 1.87m (6'1") height, despite there being room for it to be higher and ironically the toilet was a little high and left my feet dangling when I sat on it. Everything was very clean and I found the staff very polite and helpful. Didn't have the breakfast but €2 for a large pot of tea, cake and some dried fruit was excellent value for money. I'd definately stay here again, but ask for as room at the rear of the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy and hot”
Reviews.Author: DavidOHalloran
Reviews.Content: Male owner was rude on arrival, had to leave windows open with heat at night and got bitten to pieces by Mosquitos. Noisy roadworks starting at 7.30am each morning, very annoying. Breakfast fine but overpriced. Other staff nice, relatively cheap, near a metro, small but nicely furnished.

Reviews.Title: “Cute Parisian hotel”
Reviews.Author: zhaces
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights at the beginning of our honeymoon. Before leaving Canada, I bought an airport shuttle voucher online, which cost me about $50 for the both of us. I've heard about others who spent $100 Euros by taking a taxi to this hotel from CDG. The shuttle was very good as it was just us and another couple in the van. The hotel room itself was very small but cute. It had the smallest washroom I've ever been in. We slept very well but being in Paris, the street traffic started very early in the morning. The location was good, as there was a cafe on the corner but it was almost an hour walk to the Eiffel tower. I didn't like the fact that you had to leave your key when leaving the hotel but I kept all our valuables on us at all times. I would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Over-rated”
Reviews.Author: TravlinGuy
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in August with my wife and daughter for 4 nights. The good: Relatively low cost for Paris. Restaurants, market, and metro nearby. Pop, bottled water, coffee for 1.50 euro's. Msr. Antoinne (front desk in the evening) was very helpful and is fluent in English. Mme. Sophie, the owner, seems to thoroughly enjoy running the hotel and tried to be a good host (but was not there much, unfortunately). Free (but spotty and quirky) wi-fi. The bad: Not very clean. We were left towels on two different occasions that had large brown spots on them. Disgusting. The elevator is tiny. It's slightly larger than a coffin. You can't fit more than one person and a piece of luggage in the elevator. No air conditioning. But this is common on Paris, everywhere you go. The French say it doesn't get hot enough in France to need air conditioning. But don't believe them. It gets hot and humid. We did not buy the 9 euro breakfast because it was too expensive. It included bread, pastries (one or two types), ham, cheese, hot drinks, and juice. Most of the staff does not speak English, and it was difficult to communicate with them, even if you know a little French. Msr. Francoise (one of the owners) does not seem to like people. When we checked in, Mme. Sophie took us upstairs to see the alternative rooms they offered (they were painting the family suite we had reserved). My wife asked about leaving the luggage in the lobby, and Msr. Francoise snapped, "Don't worry about it." I'd read other reviews about him, so I was not surprised. One morning Msr. Francoise saw me coming in with pastries from a local boulangier (sp?) for breakfast. To my surprise, he suggested that we eat the pastries in the breakfast area (where the hotel's breakfast is served). We took him up on his offer, which seemed uncharacteristically gracious of him. But his moment of being a good host didn't last long. He kept watching us like a hawk (actually stepping away from his front desk duties to stare at us). It was as if he was afraid we would eat something off the buffet without paying for it--which we would never do. And if he was afraid of that, why did he offer the breakfast room to us? Quite odd. Msr. Francoise also left a lasting impression when we checked out. The day before we left, I had asked Mme. Sophie about a taxi to the airport for the following day. She said she would reserve one for the next day and let me know. When we returned to the hotel that evening, there was nothing indicating that Mme. Sophie had reserved the taxi (no note, no message). I asked Msr. Antoinne at the front desk if Mme. Sophie had made the taxi reservation, and he said that she did not tell him if she did. So, I made my own taxi reservation, with Msr. Antoinne's help. This was about 9 PM. At about midnight, Msr. Antoinne phoned me and told me that Mme. Sophie had just told him that she made the taxi reservation and that it would be 60 euro's. My taxi was only going to be 50 euro's, so I told him I would rather use mine. He said that was fine and that he would cancel the other taxi. The next morning, unfortunately, Msr. Francois was at the front desk when we began the ordeal of getting our luggage down the elevator one piece at a time. Francois asked me first thing whether I had ordered a taxi. I said yes. He said Sophie ordered a taxi and had already prepaid for it. Why you would prepay for a taxi and not tell a guest like you were supposed to, I don't know. I tried to explain to Francois what had transpired when I made the reservation, but he cut me off and said it didn't matter and acted quite disgusted. He apparently canceled the more expensive taxi that Sophie had ordered. When we finally got all our luggage downstairs, I tried to explain to Francois again what had transpired the night before about the taxi and why I had ordered my own. Again he cut me off and said it didn't matter. I finally told him that it did matter and that I wanted him to know what had happened. He listened, looking disgusted, but never apologized and never acknowledged that it was his staff's mistake that caused the misunderstanding. Msr. Francois just does not know how to give good customer service. Overall I would not stay here again due to the unclean conditions (dirty towels left for our use) and Msr. Francois's lack of customer service. There are thousand of other hotels in Paris. Why stay someplace that is not clean and where you are not appreciated as a customer?

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at a good price for Paris”
Reviews.Author: Lydia B
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at la Maison Montparnasse for a 3-nights stay in August. It's a nice little hotel located in the 14th, near a Métro station (Pernety), great for the price. We had a great time. Our room was clean, small, but not as small as some hotels in Paris, the bed was really comfortable and the room provided everything necessary : 4 pillows, 2 nightstands, one chair and a little desk, an airdryer, enough towels, etc. The only "problem" is that the bed had no over bedsheet, but only a feather bed (too hot for August). The bathroom was fine, but the toilet is in a different place, very very small (you don't really have place for your legs, because of the door). We took our breakfast at the hotel, it was great (the croissants were delicious), a little overpriced (9 euros), but it was something less to think about when waking up. The hotel is a little outside the center of Paris, but with the Métro, you're in the center in no time. The neighbourhood is great with cafés, restaurants, bakerys and real Parisians! The receptionist recommended us a restaurant, two steps away, and it was really great (La Cantine du Troquet). We'll probably stay there again next time we're in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “We had a great time!”
Reviews.Author: HeatherG2401
Reviews.Content: Lovely little hotel with English speaking staff (who were also quite patient to indulge my attempts at speaking French!) Good location in a quiet neighbourhood which felt safe when walking about; close to the Metro so it's very easy to get to all of the tourist spots. The room was small but clean and very comfortable; in fact the bed was amazing. The continental breakfast was slightly overpriced but there are plenty of boulangeries nearby. We had a late flight home but the staff were happy to store our luggage so that we could enjoy our final day in Paris. We enjoyed our stay at this hotel very much!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great value”
Reviews.Author: voyageurs_en_france
Reviews.Content: We took a family trip to Paris and had a great stay at the Hotel Montparnasse. We had the junior suite and a double room. The rooms were clean, the beds were comfortable, the showers were great and the staff was friendly and extremely helpful. The hotel has a computer available for guests to use in the lobby and my daughter was able to use her laptop in the room. Breakfast was delicious. The hotel is well located. It's very close to the Pernety metro stop so we were able to get everywhere we needed to go. This hotel is a great value. It is not a luxury property but it has everything necessary for a comfortable and enjoyable visit. We ranged in age from 21 - 78 and we were all happy with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: DStravelbugs
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the last 2 nights of our 6 night stay in Paris. The hotel staff is polite and they were kind enough to let us drop off our bags early before we headed out again. The free wi-fi was much appreciated as we used it to research train times and the airport shuttle. The colorful modern decor is fun. However, we didn't give this hotel high ratings because some of the design elements weren't functional. The toilet in our bathroom was wedged between the three walls of the bathroom so there was no place to put your knees. And navigating the narrow circular staircase and the awkardly placed elevator with luggage was tiring and cumbersome. The location of the hotel is great. Having already experienced the more tourist side of Paris, we really appreciated the local neighborhood feel around this hotel. Walking with the locals as they come home from work and being able to buy a tasty baguette for a good price was one of the simple pleasures we enjoyed while staying in this neighborhood. It's quieter since it's away from the hustle and bustle of the main part of Montparnasse but it's also an easy walk to all those restaurants in that main part. It's several blocks from the metro station and about a half mile walk to the Montparnasse train station where we picked up a direct train to Versaille and caught the Air France airport bus to CDG. We would stay in this neighborhood again but may look into staying at another hotel (or maybe an apartment) next time.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly, GREAT location, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: TMC0990
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, very helpful, TV does not play big sporting events, but close ot Metro stop that has a sports pub with huge TVs, clean and comfy and small rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ovemunk
Reviews.Content: Really a good hotel. My Wife and i stayed there for 5 nights and enjoyed it very much. The hotel is situated in a quiet neigbourghood but with plenty of small shops, cafes and bistros and a 5 minute walk to the nearest metrostation. The breakfast was excellent and the staff was very helpfull. The room was small but adequate the only minor snag was that there could have been some shelves to put your clothes on but otherwise it was quite nice. the hotel is a perfect base for exploring Paris and if you buy 1-2 or 5 day passes to public transport you can get around cheap. The Metro is efficient and gets you around Paris quickly. The Hotel has access to a parking house nearby which is quite old and has narrow acess but it is usable and nescessary as there are NO other parking available. It is not free but the price is reasonably.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed our stay here!”
Reviews.Author: cmur
Reviews.Content: Staff were super fiendly and helpful, rooms were clean and breakfast was delicious. Great location too!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: cordelia2512
Reviews.Content: Five stars review for this does not mean that it ranks with the luxury hotels of the world, but that it offers excellent (3*) value for Paris where high prices,poor service and poor qualty are common. Apart from the price there are many excellent things: 1. A welcoming staff, run by people who care about the business 2. Attention to detail (e.g. free computer and wi-fi access, umbrellas, little extras as part of the breakfast, up to date guide books, possibility to buy tea/coffee etc (2E - which is much cheaper than in local cafes), careful consideration of any special requests. 3. An outdoor sitting area for breakfast and nice small lobby 4. Quiet and clean 5. Local area is perhaps a bit like Paris as it exists in the Nouvelle Vague films and more romanticised in Amelie (lots of patisseries, , greengrocers, bistros (where you may find local people singing French chanson) - the hotel itself makes this point, saying it was the area Brassens lived for many years)) plus Asian food, a good beer shop. Don't miss the Rue de Thermopyles The rooms were normal Paris size (small) but well designed with clear lines and good quality curtains (quite rare in a 3* hotel). Breakfast is good by French 3* standards - much much cheaper than buying similar food/drinks in cafes)

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel in a lovely area”
Reviews.Author: irishguydub25
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel. It's a three minute walk from the nearest metro station which is just a few stops from the city centre of Paris while the area around the hotel has the feel of a nice local area, great patisseries and small shops and supermarkets. Inside the rooms are quiet, clean and comfortable, while the staff are most helpful and friendly. There's also free internet and tv with some english language stations. All in all an excellent choice to stay in Paris at an excellent price.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable and welcoming”
Reviews.Author: Bri77_uk
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my mother based on reading on here that they offered 'junior suites' which are effectively an adjoining good size single room and 'bijou' double room, both with their own en suite - these can be booked as one on their website, which was very useful. Both rooms were spotless and the beds very comfortable, although there was little space to hang clothes and the bathrooms were quite small but had good quality rain showers with separate spray. Breakfast was minimal, but did last from 7-12... whether it's value for money with all the shops nearby is questionable. The staff were all very friendly efficient and welcoming and the colour-coding of the floors was a nice touch. The lift was very small, so the stairs gave our legs a work-out, but that was nothing compared with some of the Metro stations! (). The location is good - a little out of the city centre, but surrounded by shops and restaurants (including Aquarius, a great vegetarian restaurant in Paris!). Line 13 Metro, Pernety is a few minutes walk away too, and I recommend visiting the Montparnasse Tower above Montparnasse-Bienvenue station (2 stops) for some great views without the queues. If staying in Paris again I would definitely consider returning here.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place!”
Reviews.Author: RegePG
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay! The rooms and bathrooms are a tad small but honestly it's probably about the same as all other Paris hotels. It's very close to the metro and has some nice shops and restaurants around it. The hotel staff is very nice. The walls are thin in the hotel. If someone is in the hallway at night and is fumbling around or talking, you will be able to hear them. But I wouldn't let that throw you off of this wonderful hotel - get some ear plugs and call it a day! The owners are a husband and a wife. The wife is very sweet, helpful and friendly. The husband is very, very helpful and attentive as well, however, he is not necessarily as "warm and fuzzy" as this wife but don't let that throw you off (I noticed a previous comment about him).

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: pooka711
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed for two nights and loved this hotel - it was beautifully re-done. The staff were great. Wonderful location in a not so touristy neighborhood but lots of shops and cafes. It is very close to Perenty metro stop which is great.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely clean hotel minutes from the Metro and a real gem in Paris”
Reviews.Author: ClaudiaI82
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. I had a single room which was small but not that small. The decor just made me smile but best of all was the amazing bed. As others have said, the matress was great and I was very cosy on the top floor. The only reason I had any trouble sleeping was I was woken at about 5 by someone I think trying to lug their suitcase down the spiral stairs. So a word of warning - the lift is too tiny for very large suitcases; the stairs is a sweeping spiral of colourful carpet but I'm very glad I only had an overnight bag to carry up. I do think that the breakfast is a rip off at 9Euros + tax - two streets down is a boulangerie for the essential French pastries et al. However, to be fair they have a little garden courtyard and indoor breakfast area which was a great way to while away some time over breakfast reading the free interior design magasines on offer. I also found it very useful to be able to use the internet on my phone although it times out quite quickly but it was pretty handy to have free wifi. I wasn't there much, but whilst at the hotel I found the staff very helpful and polite. The location is also good because there are restaurants, bank machines and individual shops on the road from the Metro Station (Pernety) but about 10 mins walk the other way from the hotel is a larger road with a little supermarket and you can actually walk to Montparnasse station which is well connected to other lines. I would really recommend the hotel as a base to see Paris, I got the Visite Paris metro ticket and easily got about to all the sites. Enjoy your trip!

Reviews.Title: “Super place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: MonsterBabes
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at La Maison Montparnasse and it was a super spot to stay. The rooms are quite small, but for Paris, that is completely normal. The room was spotless, and the linen on the bed was great quality and fresh. The bathroom was also very clean, but rather small, although we managed perfectly. The common areas in the place are decorated in funky colours with lots of bright decorations. All of the concierges at the front desk were incredibly helpful and willing to assist us with anything, and most wer able to speak a little English too. The breakfast (which was an extra 9 Euros per person), was also good. In addition to the normal breads / baguettes etc there was a nice selection of cereals, yoghurts, cheese and even cake! From a location point of view, you are 2 minutes walk from 2 metro stations which makes getting there quite easy. Plus, lots of great shops in that vicinity where you can buy baked goods, cheeses, fruit etc.

Reviews.Title: “Good things come in small packages...”
Reviews.Author: murghh
Reviews.Content: La Maison Montparnasse is cozy, but delivers the same standard that I would expect from one of the big hotel chains- clean, comfortable rooms and a friendly, professional staff. Montparnasse is a quieter residential area rather than a tourist hot spot, but that is not necessarily a disadvantage. Besides the Metro is less than five minutes walk away. Would definetly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: mikevn
Reviews.Content: Like all small hotels in Paris, Maison Montparnasse has a tiny reception, a tightly-wound staircase, a one-person lift and compact bedrooms; yet this place is an absolute gem. Unlike any other small hotel I have stayed in, MM has a wonderful ambiance of contemporary charm and total comfort. Whether it is owner Sophie Meisel or one of her young assistants and night porters at the front desk (including the inestimable Samy!), the welcome is warm and assistance is friendly. The hotel is only three years old, so the fittings and deco is still quite new. The bed would have to be one of the most comfortable I have slept in - quite luxurious! And the tiny little toilet and shower is pristine, clean and more than adequate. Breakfast is 9 euro, but an extraordinarily good buffet of croissants, baguette, yoghurt, fruit, cereal, cake, endless coffee and more. You'll find that hard to beat anywhere else. The location is slightly off the beaten track in Paris, which is a plus if you're a tourist; its got the feel of a local quarter, and its close to a metro and Montparnasse station so not really far from anywhere. There's also a Velib station at the end of the street if you want to get around by bicycle - its about 15 - 20 minutes by bike to St Germain des Pres. There are lots of good places to buy food in Rue Raymond Losserand around the corner, and there's a Monoprix supermarket a few minutes away. The local bars are not all that hot, but one local establishment I would hightly recommend is La Cantine du Troquet, where I ate twice - you'll have to wait at the bar if you arrrive after 7pm but the food is sensational and not expensive. I found MM on the internet and ended up staying here three times as I came and went from Paris over the month, and I'm couldn't have been happier with it.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and helpful, such a lovely little place for few days”
Reviews.Author: thecuri0ustraveller
Reviews.Content: Went with my daughter as her dream 21st brithday treat. OUr first choice of place was cancelled so were concerned about the distance the other place we we stayed at, but it turned out for the better. It was comfortable and very clean, we did expected our room to be on the small size as stated in tripadvisor previous comments and its true regarding en-suite being tiny but it was fine with us, the shower was lovely! Excellent buffet breakfast, we paid 9 euros per morning which we felt compared to the local bistro that charged 50c or surprisley more for just a drink, crossiants and juice,here there were bowl of nuts, fresh fruits, crossiants, cakes, yoghurt, cereals, juices, ham/cheese, bread, tea and different flavours teas and there are no limit to how much you want to eat! We were surprised it only got 2 stars as we felt it should deserved 3 stars. Very close to nearby metro station, very good value if you get few days pass to take you to all star attraction, it was easier than we first thought and work out alot cheaper. Plenty of places to eat out, some more expensive than the others. If disabled as in deafness, bring proof as you get free entrance to most attractions and students under 24 is the same. Visit early to avoid long queue or in some places go at nights. We only paid nearly 5 euro(half of the original cost) to go up the Eiffel Tower and it's worth climbing the 284 steps up the Arc De Triomph. We went to the Lourve and Pompedi on the same day but would advised to go on a diiferent day. Monmatre is really a pretty old fashinoned Paris when visiting the Sacre de Cour, the market square is full of fabulous artists and lovely little parisan houses. Worth visiting the Molin Rouge, the walks along the River Seine is worth is and see Notre Dame in it glory. Be aware of fraud woment pretending to be deaf and mute, there are alot of them in some certain areas as well as men trying to encourage you in buying souvenir gifts, get them from reputable shops instead. Would definetly used this little hotel again..

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money and a very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: DavidZisner
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at La Maison for 4 nights, and we had a great time. This is our first time in Paris, and we were looking for a cozy, quiet place which is not too expensive. We arrived at La Maison following recommendations on TripAdvisor and were not disappointed. The staff were charming and professional, the rooms clean and tidy and the breakfast buffet was more than enough (although they were curiously not included in the room price, but that may have been a mistake on my side). The staff gave us a very "homely" feeling and even let us use the kitchen to prepare sandwiches on our last night. Montparnasse is not a central neighborhood (which we liked), and its surroundings very quiet and tranquil. The Metro is 2 minutes' walk from the hotel so every location inside and outside of Paris are easily accessible. Note that this is a hotel for thin people (the elevator's tiny and the rooms are not too big), which luckily we are. We will definitely return to La Maison in our future.

Reviews.Title: “Great location ! Great Service! Bijou Room!”
Reviews.Author: LondonAnnie41
Reviews.Content: A friendly greeting awaited us and the service was efficient .Free wi fi. The breakfast - muesli, fresh croissants and delicious home made jams. The only down side for breakfast was the coffee. Our room was on the top floor and very quiet, accessed by a tiny lift of which you need to take care as you exit onto an unlit staircase. The room itself was extremely bijou and there was no room for anything except the comfortable bed. This hotel is in a great location, 3 mins from metro and surrounded by real shops - fromagerie, boulangerie, patisserie as well as cafes restaurants etc. Real people - ie not tourists live in this area so the top location to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “good room and location”
Reviews.Author: iMoris
Reviews.Content: It's cute designed hotel. The room was modern, clean. we could use free wi-fi. It's relatively cheap. And location is very good (close to metro). I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in Paris”
Reviews.Author: sensasix
Reviews.Content: lovely neighbourhood with bars and restaurants about 15 min walk from boulvard montparnasse / montparnasse station, closest metro stop about 3 mins walk. Smallish rooms however well organised, bright and modern yet comfy, great bed. Owners seem to be more on the arrogant side of things (guess Paris has to keep up a reputation for that after all but rest of staff very welcoming) Very good breakfast, different jams, fresh bread, coffee, fruits etc. A gem at a great price in a city full of mediocre expensive hotels

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet, friendly, simple. Excellent value. Very small room.”
Reviews.Author: pienol
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Maison Montparnasse for 2 nights in December 2010 on weekdays. My general impression is very positive. By Paris standards nowadays, this hotel is outstanding value for money. If you don't mind small rooms (I don't mind at all but this one was probably the smallest I ever slept in!) and value quietness, friendliness, cleanness and simplicity, this is an excellent choice. It sits in a very nice, quiet neighbourhood just south of Montparnasse, full of food shops (bakers, butchers, groceries) and small restaurants. If you are in Paris for tourism, be aware that this is not close to most tourist attractions (Notre-Dame, Tour Eiffel, St-Germain-des-Pres) though the metro will take you there in roughly 15-25 minutes. However, compared to staying at Saint-Germain-des-Pres, a short metro ride buys you a much better accommodation and/or a much lower price -- in short: much better value for money. The hotel is conveniently located half way between the Plaisance and Pernety metro stations, on line 13, both a 5 minute walk. If you are travelling through Charles-de-Gaulle airport and want to avoid the very expensive taxi ride to central Paris, take the RER (suburban train) line B direct to the Denfert Rochereau station, from where a short taxi ride (less than 10 euros?) will take you to the hotel. The room was very small but very clean. The bed was very comfortable (I had 2 excellent nights' sleep). Breakfast was simple but very good (delicious home-made ham and fantastic 'baguette' bread from next-door baker). Wi-Fi internet access is free. The staff was friendly and helpful, easy going yet polite. I am French (now living abroad) so I cannot judge their language skills. I will use La Maison Montparnasse again in the future and will advise friends and colleagues to do the same.

Reviews.Title: “If you want a heavenly bed and really quaint hotel this is the place to stay!!!!”
Reviews.Author: chester_aka_justin
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel with great care as all the reviews were very good and were very consistent. We arrived in Paris very late on the Sunday night at CDG and we made our way from CDG to Pernety on the RER and the Metro. Total time was 1h 15mins and we emerged from the station just before midnight not knowing where the hotel was! We eventually found it with the help of a taxi driver. We were pretty skeptical about getting some food at around midnight but eventually found an all night pizza parlour just around the corner...The hotel was in a very quiet street, Rue de Gergovie, and was very quickly seen as they had some flags flying outside. The receptionist on arrival was extremely polite and was very pleasant and spoke english. We had missed our flight the night before and we only managed to get there for one night. We didn't ask for a refund of this as we felt that it wasn't the hotel's fault but they were very helpful in assisting us with anything. WIFI was free even though it was a little weak and didn't always log on, but at least it was free unlike alot of places. The bathroom was very small but they had all the amenities including Hairdryer, mirror and WC and a lovely powerful shower with fixed shower head and a handset. The beds were heavenly and very large. The pillows and the sheets were so clean crisp. TV in each room and included CNN news channel, the rest was all french TV (but what do you expect !!). In the morning the breakfast was served in the dinning room, a full continental breakfast including meats, cheeses, cereals, fruit juice, tea, coffee and croissants and Pain au chocolat. The receptionist also doubled up as the waiter for the breakfast and cleared one of the tables on the side that was being used for brochures in order for us to sit comfortably. All I would suggest, if you are a tea drinker, then bring your own tea! The only tea they have is Earl Grey and some french Tizzannes.... They were very willing to take in our bags and keep them back until later that day at NO charge. As a gesture the hotel didn't charge us for breakfast as we had not been able to get there the first night...we would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to anyone...HIGHLY RECOMMENDED....would stay there again at a drop of a hat.... Our recommendation would be that if you use the metro to get around, get the Paris Visite Card it makes life so much easier!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Extremely comfortable place and a lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: allaboardtoottoot
Reviews.Content: The place is lovely and has fresh new decor. The female owner (the only staff member we really had contact with) had great hospitality and was extremely helpful - answering every question and recommending an amazing local family run french restaurant. Great clean rooms, nice and quiet with a modern bathroom. The only downside is that the rooms are very small with not a lot of room to move about and ours had a hanging pole rather than a wardrobe. All in all an incredibly comfortable and clean place, a good price and excellent bed linen. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem - what a wonderful find!”
Reviews.Author: satori00
Reviews.Content: I have high standards for hotels and was very pleasantly surprised by the wonderful stay I had at this hotel. For the rate I was paying, I had expected much less. Instead, I received excellent service, a clean and modern, renovated room in a safe, convenient location. The proprietor and his wife and staff speak excellent English and were accomodating of my early arrival. The breakast featured homemade jams and cake which were great and the value was wonderful. I recommend this place without hesitation! Note: The transfer to the blue line at Montparnasse Bienevenue is a long walk. I exited there and walked to the hotel once by the Gaite metro and felt a bit less safe, probably because it was August and the streets were more deserted. But the Pernety area and the metro line were completely safe. The neighborhood is very convenient with a few shops, cafes, supermarket, pharmacy around. Also the cemetery is in walking distance if you want a place nearby to jog or run.

Reviews.Title: “Push the wall and add a star”
Reviews.Author: weho69
Reviews.Content: Great design, nice choices of colors, no street noise if room on the back side, good breakfast and great prices if booked with rebates. The bad sides : bad sound proof so you hear the guests outside your door. On room 29 and 21, you'll have to let the toilet door open if you want to ... wipe yourself as the toilet room is extremely small!!! We actually had a huge laugh about this! The prices annonced are too expensive but we paid 200E for 3 nights with Hotels.com so no complain!

Reviews.Title: “A cosy home away from home”
Reviews.Author: TravellingCloudberry
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at La Maison Montparnasse. We found the hosts nothing short of delightful and completely charming. In fact, all the staff were wonderful and always ready and willing to help us with anything we needed (directions, travel tips, sightseeing info etc). We were celebrating our wedding anniversary and the hosts gladly arranged a beautiful bunch of flowers in our room for our arrival. The rooms were super clean and fresh which is always on the top of our wish list. The quality of the furnishings, fittings and linens was very high and we had a wall mounted TV in our room. Yes the rooms are relatively small but you'll find that in any major city unless you fork out for five star accommodation. The bathrooms are also tiny but again, we've found this to be the case in almost every capital city boutique hotel we've stayed in (eg. London, New York, Helsinki). Air conditioning would have been great but being in such a quite neighbourhood allowed us to sleep comfortably with the windows open in the summertime. Contrary to previous reviewers, we found the 9 euro breakfast buffet excellent value. Every day we were served fresh baked croissants, baguettes and delicious coffee. Fresh sliced ham and cheese are available for your (divine!) baguettes and a wide selection of quality jams were laid out to slather on the luscious croissants. The hostess even bakes her own cakes which are included in the buffet. There was also a good selection of juices, yoghurt, fresh fruit and cereal. You can sit outside in the lovely grapevine-lined courtyard garden or inside at one of the funky dining tables. The location is great if you don't mind taking the metro into the city (anywhere between 6-8 stops depending on where you're going). The evenings in the neighbourhood were very quiet which is lovely after a long day sightseeing. Just around the corner you'll find a reasonable selection of cafes, bistros, a cheese shop, a few bakeries, and a creperie. The metro Pernety is only a couple of hundred metres away from the hotel which was very handy for our daily adventures. La Maison Montparnasse is a great value boutique hotel where you can feel comfortable and safe while enjoying the city of Paris. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Francoise bourgeois”
Reviews.Author: day_V51
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Le Maison Montparnasse for 3 nights at the beginning of our vacation while enjoying some of the sites in Paris. We found the Hotel to be very clean with small (but typical) rooms for Europe. The lift still does not work so if you are on the 4th floor good luck. There is a nice outside Patio for Breakfast consisting of fresh Croissant, Baggett, cheeses, yogurt, juice and coffee, again a typical Petit de jouner. The weekend staff are very helpful as is Sophie (I assume the owner). Franciose on the other hand should probably stick to Kitchen duties and avoid customer contact since his nature is very cold and rude. Not having any experience with Hotels in Paris I went by reviews on Trip Advisor and although not completely dissatisfied would not stay here again as there are other hotels less expensive in just as good a location and no Francoise. We found this out at the end of our vacation when we stayed at a hotel near Gare de Lyon.

Reviews.Title: “A Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: trekkinghorners
Reviews.Content: We stayed at La Mason Montparnasse at the begining and end of our month long trip to France. Simply, Sophie and Francoise are wonderful hosts. We were travelling with bicycles and they helped with the logistics to and from the Paris airport. We observed them giving helpful and personal service to others as well. The hotel is small, clean, delgihtful, and very personal. Also I thought very good value. Breakfast are well above average for hotels in his price range. It is well located for touring Paris or travel by train to and from Paris. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: martinhaa
Reviews.Content: Positive: Clean rooms, good breakfast, receptionists spoke English. Quiet neighborhood. Near metro. Good beds. Fine Wi-fi. Negative: Purely formal hoteliers (seemed stressed and not relaxed towards guests), small room with a small toilet. Expensive breakfast. We got an offer price - so total ok - but their standard prices are too expensive compared to quality.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at this lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: DoritS
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our 4 nights stay in this renovated hotel. Good location, close to Metro station, very nice breakfast and friendly hosts. Every morning they went to the nearby boulangerie for fresh baguet and croissants. Rooms are very clean, even though a bit small, as typical in Paris. The only thing missing is a wardrobe. Would deffinitely recommend it. While you are there, don't miss the Nuxis chef restaurant nearby - it was the hotel's recommendation and ours too! great food for reasonable price and the friendly chef translated the whole menu to English.

Reviews.Title: “A super little place that was perfect for my working stay.”
Reviews.Author: bennett-griffins
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my week's stay in this lovely little hotel, which I chose for its relative proximity to the Paris Expo centre at Porte de Versailles. I received a genuinely warm welcome from the owners (a Parisien couple who speak excellent English) and felt everything about this place hit the spot - both in terms of the hotel itself and its fabulous location in a genuinely lively, untouristy and unspoilt part of Montparnasse that had numerous excellent restaurants, cafes, boulangeries etc all within a 5 or 10 minute walk (I'd particularly recommend L'Entrepot, a bistro/bar/cinema that's both stylish & informally friendly). The hotel has been newly refurbished in an understated contemporary 'boutique' style and the high standards of the upkeep and furnishings in my room (a single, which was small but perfectly adequate for my working trip - and I did have quite a bit of luggage with me) made me feel I got great value for my money. They also served a high quality simple breakfast of top-notch bread, croissants, cheese, artisan preserves & fruit, which really set me up each day.

Reviews.Title: “Small and still a building site, not ready yet...”
Reviews.Author: euricocovas
Reviews.Content: The rooms are small, even the triple room, e.g., no wardrobe, which we would expect on a hotel in the boutique hotel section. True, the rooms are all done up to modern boutique stylish decor, but, still small. And the lifts (not ready) and stairs are a building site at the moment (dec 09), so it cannot have a reference on myboutiquehotel.com as "fully refurbished". When we said we would not stay 4 nights cause of the building work, we were told to shut up ("stop!" as the French staff said) and thrown out of the hotel in a rude manner. Sorry... the rooms furniture etc is boutique level, but all the rest is very cheap, and a hotel with a building site inside should be closed till ready or instead put a discount price....

Reviews.Title: “Well-finished, trendy and friendly place - some rooms are small”
Reviews.Author: Catalan2
Reviews.Content: There's lots of good things to say: the lady owner is very helpful - umbrellas, maps, restaurant advice; the area is fine and safe (interesting to be just out the main toursist centre) with easy metro access to everywhere and good array of shops and restaurants nearby (we liked Rue Daguerre especially), the decor and finsih is trendy, new and colourful. The beds and bedding are a step-up in tihs price range. Only downside is that the stairs are narrow and steep especially if you are on the third floor and although a lift is just about finished it will still be challenging for elderly people with heart ailments but that's not the target client group! We changed our first room (31) because it was small with a very tight WC cabinet - the second room (36) was absolutey fine and made our stay much more enjoyable. We would definately recommend the place and the area if you want a little bit of authentic Parisenne street life. Didn't have a chance to try breakfast (which is very usefully served until 12 noon!) because we slept so well in the great beds! We were given internet access but didn't have time to try it out. We wish the owners succcess with their venture.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic reception,very helpfull, excellent in all aspects”
Reviews.Author: annrobmar
Reviews.Content: I highly recommand this cute hotel. The rooms are not huge, but you have what you need , it is very clean and fresh,there breakfast is very nice too= with nice croissants,home made cakes, fresh french stick, country jams ect... The owners are there during the day , they will help you in anything you need and that with a smile.,they also speak english quit well. The hotel in situated quit central a short walk to the metro. Stay there and you will not be sorry.

HotelInfo.Name: La Maison Montparnasse
HotelInfo.Address: 53, rue de Gergovie, 75014 Paris, France
